intro: Mariosousa millefolia, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It is characterized by its feathery, finely divided leaves and clusters of small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Mariosousa millefolia is also a popular garden plant due to its ornamental value and ability to attract beneficial insects.
